required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single-lumen 5Fr and Triple-lumen 6Fr PICCs Are Accurate for Hemodynamic Measurement by Transpulmonary Thermodilution.
clinical_study.official_title: Single-lumen 5Fr and Triple-lumen 6Fr PICCs Are Accurate for Hemodynamic

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

clinical_study.source: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

brief_summary.textblock: Peripherally inserted central catheters (PICCs) are increasingly used in intensive care unit (ICU) as an alternative to centrally inserted central catheters (CICCs) for intravenous infusion. In the present study the investigators try to assess their reliability for measuring cardiac index (CI) with trans-pulmonary thermodilution (TPTD) technique.

primary_outcome.description: comparison of hemodynamic measurements made by the TPTD from the VolumeView/EV1000TM system via PICC vs. CICC.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of single-lumen 5Fr PICCs to CICC
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of single-lumen 5 Fr PICCs to CICC in their reliability of assessing cardiac output

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of triple-lumen 6Fr PICCs to CICC
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of triple-lumen 6 Fr PICCs to CICC in their reliability of assessing cardiac output

intervention.description: Thermodilution was attempted via PICC and via CICC in the same patient

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients (≥18 years) admitted to the ICU
- Patients requiring hemodynamic monitoring using EV1000TM
- Patients having both PICC and CICC in place (these patients had their PICC replaced with a CICC, usually at the time of ICU admission, or vice versa, usually at the end of their ICU stay, and were enrolled immediately after the placement of the new device before the previous one was removed)
Exclusion Criteria:
- body weight <40 kg
- severe aortic regurgitation or intra-cardiac shunt
- treatment with an intra-aortic balloon pump
- contraindication for placement of PICC, CICC or a femoral arterial catheter
- abdominal aneurism
- extracorporeal circulation
- pregnancy
- lack of informed consent

overall_official.affiliation: Università Cattolica del sacro Cuore- Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli IRCSS
